I'd highly recommend "Misery" (1987), a gripping tale set in the late 20th century, starring Richard Farnsworth and Rob Reiner. The story unfolds during the Balkan intersections, focusing on Abraham's family as they struggle to survive amidst persecutions and disease.

If you're interested in a period drama, "The Woodlanders" (1887) might be an intriguing choice for you. Set in a rural corner of South England during the same time period, it tells the story of Grace Melbury, a woman torn between her childhood love and a charming doctor.

On the other hand, if you prefer more contemporary stories with gritty realism, "End of Watch" is a compelling choice. It follows two Los Angeles police officers and their encounters with criminal forces beyond their control, starring Jake Gyllenhaal and Michael Peña. Both films offer captivating narratives that delve deeper than you might initially think!

I'd highly recommend "Eyes Wide Shut" to you. This intriguing film, directed by the legendary Stanley Kubrick, tells the story of a Manhattan doctor who embarks on a surreal night-long journey after his wife admits to unfulfilled longings. The cast includes talented actors like Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman, making it a must-see for fans of Mary Ann Shaffer's writing style!

Alternatively, "Surrogates" is another interesting choice, set in a futuristic world where humans live through robotic surrogates. This film stars Bruce Willis and explores themes similar to those found in The English Patient. Enjoy the journey into a world where reality blurs with technology!
